meanings.def: a structure made of wood or wire supported with posts that is put between two areas of land as a boundary, or around a garden, field, etc. to keep animals in, or to keep people and animals out
examples: The two women chatted over the garden fence.
Security guards with dogs patrolled the perimeter fence.
The footpath was blocked by a barbed wire fence.
The house was surrounded by a white picket fence.
She walked over to the tall wooden privacy fence.
There was a cottage garden at the front and a white picket fence.
a fence around the site
the airport perimeter fence
the fence line separating the United States from Mexico

examples: The White House already is struggling to mend fences with Europe.

meanings.def: used to refer to either of two opposite opinions on an issue
examples: The two countries are often on opposite sides of the fence when it comes to climate change.
There are arguments on both sides of the aisle.

It is a proposal approved by people on both sides of the political fence.

meanings.def: to avoid becoming involved in deciding or influencing something
examples: He tends to sit on the fence at meetings.
